solution.text:
Given points are :
P = (_{i}_,_{j}_), Q = (_{{i+k}}_,_{j}_), R = (_{{i+k}}_,_{{j+l}}_), S = (_{i}_,_{{j+l}}_)
Using the distance formula we have :
\(PQ = \sqrt {(_{{i+k}}_ - _{i}_)^2 + (_{j}_ - _{j}_)^2} = \sqrt {(_{k}_)^2 + (0)^2} = \sqrt {_{{pow(k,2)}}_ + (0)}\) = _{k}_
\(QR = \sqrt {(_{{i+k}}_ - _{{k+i}}_)^2 + (_{j}_ - _{{j+l}}_)^2} = \sqrt {(0)^2 + (-_{l}_)^2} = \sqrt {0 + _{{pow(l,2)}}_}\) = _{l}_
\(RS = \sqrt {(_{i}_-_{{i+k}}_)^2 + (_{{l+j}}_ - _{{j+l}}_)^2} = \sqrt {(-_{k}_)^2 + (0)^2} = \sqrt {_{{pow(k,2)}}_ + (0)}\) = _{k}_
\(SP = \sqrt {(_{i}_ - _{i}_)^2 + (_{{j+l}}_ - _{j}_)^2} = \sqrt {(0)^2 + (_{l}_)^2} = \sqrt {0 + _{{pow(l,2)}}_}\) = _{l}_
\(PR = \sqrt {(_{{i+k}}_ - _{i}_)^2 + (_{{j+l}}_ - _{j}_)^2} = \sqrt {(_{k}_)^2 + (_{l}_)^2} = \sqrt {_{{pow(k,2)}}_ + _{{pow(l,2)}}_}\) = _{m}_
\(QS = \sqrt {(_{i}_-_{{i+k}}_)^2 + (_{j}_-_{{j+l}}_)^2} = \sqrt {(-_{k}_)^2 + (-_{l}_)^2} = \sqrt {_{{pow(k,2)}}_ + _{{pow(l,2)}}_}\) = _{m}_
Here you can see that \(PQ + QR \neq PR\)
Thus, Rahul was right that they are forming quadrilateral.
Since PQ = RS and QR = SP
This quadrilateral can be either rectangle or parallelogram or rhombus or square.
Since all 4 sides are not equal that is why it can't be square or rhombus.
But, you can see diagonals PR = QS.
Hence it is a rectangle

content.text: While playing cricket Rahul observes that he and three other fielders are forming a quadrilateral, but he is confused about which type of quadrilateral they are forming.Help him in finding the type of quadrilateral.Position of four of them in sequence are given as : (_{i}_,_{j}_), (_{{i+k}}_,_{j}_), (_{{i+k}}_,_{{j+l}}_), (_{i}_,_{{j+l}}_)
